page.title: 20Lundy's Past.
page.content: The Lundy Granite Company was set up in 1863-and there were various other attempts to exploit the island's resources.When he died in 1883 his son William Hudson Heaven took over.His ambition was to build a new church and this he achieved-though at considerable expense to the family fortunes.On his death in 1916 it passed to his nephew Walter Heaven but he sold the island 2 years later. In 1925 Martin Coles Harman bought the island.He defended the islands independence fiercely-expelling the G.P.O.and issuing his own coins.He was interested in wildlife and started the Lundy Field Society.On his death in 1954 his son Albion Harman took over Lundy but when he died in 1968 his two sisters put the island on the market. (see p.16).
